author.definition: Who is the author of this stimulus.

comment.definition: A comment on this specific stimulus.

definition:
General description of an applied stimulus. This
      section is basis of various related sections that specify
      more specific stimuli.

description.definition: A textual description of the stimulus.

intensity.definition: like the current in case of electrical stimulation.

interstimulus_interval.definition: The time between two subsequent stimulations.

location.definition: Describes the site of the stimulus application.

modality.definition: Visual, acoustic, haptic, electrical, etc. stimulation.

position.definition: The position of the stimulus on e.g the screen. Specified as a 2-tuple (x;y). By default this position refers to the top-left corner of the object or its bounding box.

position_reference.definition: By default stimulus positions are specified by the coordinates of the top-left corner (or of the bounding box). Use this property for other definitions.

repetitions.definition: The number of repetitions of the described stimulation.

spatial_extent.definition: The spatial extend of the presented stimulus (width;height) e.g. (1024;768).

stimulus_file.definition:
The stimulus file used. Using it will blow
         up the the size of the metadatafile and we recommend to
         rather define the URL of underlying stimulus
         file.

stimulus_file_url.definition:
The URL of a an applied stimulus file. This
         is the recommended alternative to explicitely including the
         actual stimulus via StimulusFile.
